intro: Clidemia obliqua, commonly known as the broadleaf mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and Central America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate to elliptic leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces small, white to pale pink flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming during the wet season. Clidemia obliqua is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
